abstract: I have to start with saying that there’s a lot of ways to write scientific articles with all of these tools. In particular, there’s some great guides from rOpenSci, packages with LaTeX templates for major publishers, and R packages to help with reproducible documents.
title: Getting started with Zotero, Better BibTeX, and RMarkdown

abstract: This blog post describes a sequence of 9 steps to set up a reproducible workflow for scientific writing based on open-source tooling. It boils down to writing the manuscript in Rmarkdown, and using a set of auxiliary tools to manage citations and output to Word to share with collaborators and to prepare the final document for submission to the journal.
title: Writing scientific papers using Rstudio and Zotero
